text: Pope Gregory IV (; c. 795-25 January 844) was an Italian priest of the Roman Catholic Church and the 102nd Pope from 11 February 731 to 28 November 741. "List of Popes," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2013-3-18. was Pope from October 827 to 25 January 844. ==Early life== Gregorius was born in Rome, but the exact date is unknown.Society for the Diffusion of Useful Knowledge. (1838). "Gregory IV," Penny cyclopaedia, Vol. 11, p. 444. ==Cardinal== Gregory was a Cardinal and head priest of the Basilica of St. Mark in Rome."Pope Gregory IV," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2013-3-18. == Pope == Gregory was elected pope in 844. During his reign, the Roman port city of Ostia was expanded. ==Gallery== File:Pigna - s Marco cripta memoria deposizioni 1190048.JPG|Tomb of Pope Gregory IV ==Related pages == * List of popes ==References== ==Other websites== * * "Gregory IV", Encyclop√¶dia Britannica, 1911 * Catholic Hierarchy, Popes in sequence Category:Italian popes Category:790s births Category:840s deaths
